title: Thieves steal from Sharjah warehouse, face amputation
text: Filed on February 9, 2017 | Last updated on February 9, 2017 at 05.28 pm Share More > Vote The two men, who confessed to breaking into a warehouse, will have their hands amputated since they are Muslims, the presiding judge said. Two Asians charged with stealing air conditioners, building material and industrial-use chemicals are facing amputation on the orders of a Sharjah Shariah court.The two men, who confessed to breaking into a warehouse, will have their hands amputated since they are Muslims, the presiding judge said, and now need to hire a lawyer to defend their case.However, since the accused do not have a lawyer, the hearing has been adjourned until the court appoints a lawyer for them.In another case, a UAE national was charged by the court for stabbing, along with 12 other men, a 25-year-old national and a 24-year-old Arab, when a brawl erupted between them in Al Qasba area in Sharjah. Amira Agarib
